id: indicates the preferred currency for settlement purposes
name: indicates the preferred currency for settlement purposes

id: contractual commitment to settle in cash
name: contractual commitment to settle in cash

id: or legally recording documents, as applicable
name: or legally recording documents, as applicable

id: specifies the strategy for settlement from a delivery perspective
name: specifies the strategy for settlement from a delivery perspective

id: If you sell a gold futures contract of say 100 troy ounces then you have to deliver real gold to the buyer on the mutually agreed date. Most derivatives are not actually exercised, but are traded out before their delivery date. However, physical delivery still occurs with some trades: it is most common with commodities, but can also occur with other financial instruments.
name: If you sell a gold futures contract of say 100 troy ounces then you have to deliver real gold to the buyer on the mutually agreed date. Most derivatives are not actually exercised, but are traded out before their delivery date. However, physical delivery still occurs with some trades: it is most common with commodities, but can also occur with other financial instruments.

id: ISO 10962, Securities and related financial instruments - Classification of financial instruments (CFI) code, Fourth Edition, October 2019
name: ISO 10962, Securities and related financial instruments - Classification of financial instruments (CFI) code, Fourth Edition, October 2019

id: Settlement.rdf version of this ontology was revised to integrate the notion of a value assessment with a settlement event and to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.
name: Settlement.rdf version of this ontology was revised to integrate the notion of a value assessment with a settlement event and to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.

id: Settlement.rdf version of this ontology was revised to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).
name: Settlement.rdf version of this ontology was revised to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: Settlement.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: Settlement.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: method and commitment to transfer a commodity, currency, security, cash or another instrument as defined in the settlement terms of the contract
name: method and commitment to transfer a commodity, currency, security, cash or another instrument as defined in the settlement terms of the contract

id: This is often stated in the form 'T+n' where n is the number of business days from the specified settlement date (T).
name: This is often stated in the form 'T+n' where n is the number of business days from the specified settlement date (T).

id: indicates the monetary amount required for cash settlement
name: indicates the monetary amount required for cash settlement

id: The Fast Automated Securities Transfer Program (FAST) is a contract between DTC (and its subsidiaries) and transfer agents whereby FAST agents act as custodians for DTC.
name: The Fast Automated Securities Transfer Program (FAST) is a contract between DTC (and its subsidiaries) and transfer agents whereby FAST agents act as custodians for DTC.

id: convention employed to determine the closing date (from the stated settlement date) in the process of settling a transaction on which securities or interests in securities are delivered, usually against (in simultaneous exchange for) payment of some consideration
name: convention employed to determine the closing date (from the stated settlement date) in the process of settling a transaction on which securities or interests in securities are delivered, usually against (in simultaneous exchange for) payment of some consideration

id: commitment to determine the delivery strategy at the time of exercise
name: commitment to determine the delivery strategy at the time of exercise

id: indicates whether the security is to be held at the transfer agent as part of the FAST (Fully Automated Securities Transfer) program
name: indicates whether the security is to be held at the transfer agent as part of the FAST (Fully Automated Securities Transfer) program

id: Note that the security price represents a price per share or per lot, whereas the settlement amount represents a total.
name: Note that the security price represents a price per share or per lot, whereas the settlement amount represents a total.

id: commitment to deliver the actual underlying asset on the specified delivery date, rather than cash
name: commitment to deliver the actual underlying asset on the specified delivery date, rather than cash

id: commitment with respect to synthetic options on foreign exchange forwards that are based on non-convertible or thinly traded currencies
name: commitment with respect to synthetic options on foreign exchange forwards that are based on non-convertible or thinly traded currencies

id: Settlement.rdf version of this ontology was revised to better integrate settlement with the overall lifecycle of a contract (FBC-317)
name: Settlement.rdf version of this ontology was revised to better integrate settlement with the overall lifecycle of a contract (FBC-317)

id: This property should only be used in cases where the settlement currency is distinct from the currency in which the instrument is denominated.
name: This property should only be used in cases where the settlement currency is distinct from the currency in which the instrument is denominated.

id: This ontology defines high-level concepts for settlement that are applicable across FIBO domain areas, such as for loans, securities, and derivatives.
name: This ontology defines high-level concepts for settlement that are applicable across FIBO domain areas, such as for loans, securities, and derivatives.

id: is fully automated securities transfer applicable
name: is fully automated securities transfer applicable

id: commitment to settle an obligation through the receipt or delivery of the actual underlying instrument(s) or other asset, such as a commodity, instead of through cash settlement
name: commitment to settle an obligation through the receipt or delivery of the actual underlying instrument(s) or other asset, such as a commodity, instead of through cash settlement

id: commitment to deliver an amount of money at the earliest available date as per settlement convention
name: commitment to deliver an amount of money at the earliest available date as per settlement convention
